attributes.action: House the homeless in Windsor Castle
attributes.additional_details:
Dudley asserts without evidence that the homeless are making a 'voluntary choice' to remain homeless: https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/jan/03/windsor-council-calls-removal-homeless-people-before-royal-wedding 
Research by Crisis shows an 134% increase in rough sleeping between 2009/10-2015/16: https://crisis.org.uk/media/236823/homelessness_monitor_england_2017.pdf. Austerity and housing costs are key factors.
Windsor Castle is 484,000 square feet with approximately 1,000 rooms.
attributes.background: The Conservative leader of Windsor Council, Simon Dudley, has called on the police to use legal powers such as the 1824 Vagrancy Act to clear the area and implement criminal behaviour orders before the royal wedding in May. We, the undersigned, call for the homeless to be rehoused in Windsor Castle.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Homelessness in Windsor is the responsibility of Windsor and Maidenhead council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www3.rbwm.gov.uk/info/200130/councillors_and_mps/811/petitions
